com.xhive.dom.interfaces
Interface XhiveLocationIf

public interface XhiveLocationIf

Represents a location in a DOM tree.

The XhiveLocationIf interface represents a location in a DOM tree typically returned as part of a location set (see XhiveLocationIteratorIf) in an XPointer or XPath query result. A location can be any type of Node that could be the result of an XPointer or XPath query. The alternatives are a point (XhivePointIf) or a range (XhiveRangeIf). To establish which type of location you are dealing with, this interface provides the getLocationType().

In order to invoke methods on a location, which are specific for its type, first cast the location to the required class, and proceed by invoking the desired method. For example, if getLocationType() returns ATTR_NODE, cast the location to org.w3c.dom.Attr, after which, for example, the attribute-specific method getValue() can be invoked to get the attribute's value.

Example usage: see function showLocations (XhiveLocationIteratorIf locations) of class samples.Reporter.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

Method Detail

getLocationType

short getLocationType()
Get the type of this location.
  • If the location type is a Node, the node type is returned.
  • If the location type is a point, XhiveLocationIf.POINT is returned.
  • If the location type is a range, XhiveLocationIf.RANGE is returned.
Both points and ranges are distinct from any of the DOM node types.

Returns:
The type of this location.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1
